==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Etymology 1===
Belongs to the *''m-'' series of negatives; see {{och-l|無|no}} for more. Cognate with the syllabic negative {{zh-l|*毋|tr=m̄, m̀}} in Min Nan and Hakka.

====Pronunciation====
{{zh-pron
|c=m4,ng4
|c_note=ng4 - hypercorrection
|cat=part
}}

====Definitions====
{{zh-hanzi}} {{tcx|lang=zh|Cantonese}}

# {{n-g|Particle placed before a verb or adjective to make it negative.}}
#: {{zh-x|唔好意思，我 唔 記得。|Sorry, I do'''n't''' remember.|C-GZ}}
#: {{zh-x|你 知 唔 知道 游水池 喺 邊度{dou6} 呀？|Do you know where the swimming pool is?|C-GZ}}
# {{n-g|Particle of hesitation or thinking.}}
#: {{zh-x|唔……不如 去 嗰 間 餐廳 吖！|'''Well'''... let's go to that restaurant!|C-GZ}}
# {{n-g|Particle of agreement.}}
#: {{zh-x|「噉樣{joeng6-2} 得 唔 得 呀？」「唔。」|"Is this OK?" "'''Uh-huh'''."|C-GZ}}

====Synonyms====
{{zh-dial|不}}

====Usage notes====
* Cantonese {{lang|zh|唔}} is the direct equivalent of Modern Standard Chinese's {{zh-l|不}}, but there are some fixed phrases where {{lang|zh|不}} cannot be substituted with {{lang|zh|唔}}. For example, {{zh-l|不可以}} is equivalent to {{zh-l|唔可以|tr=m4 ho2 ji5}} but {{zh-l|不如}} cannot become *{{lang|zh|唔如}}.
* See also [[不#Usage notes]].
